question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Simplify the following expression to a simplified fraction: $$\sqrt{\dfrac{\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{80}}+\dfrac{\sqrt{845}}{9}+\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt5}}.$$
ground_truth:
First, we'll divide $\sqrt{5}$ into each term in the numerator of the fraction inside the big radical: $$\sqrt{\dfrac{\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{80}}+\dfrac{\sqrt{845}}{9}+\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt5}}=
\sqrt{\frac{5}{\sqrt{80}\cdot\sqrt{5}} + \frac{\sqrt{845}}{9\sqrt{5}} + \frac{\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt{5}}}.
$$Let's attack each fraction within the square root separately. First, $$\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{80}\cdot\sqrt5}=\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{400}}=\dfrac{5}{20}=\dfrac{1}{4}.$$The second one is trickier: $$\dfrac{\sqrt{845}}{9\sqrt5}=\dfrac{\sqrt{169}}{9}=\dfrac{13}{9}.$$Finally, $\dfrac{\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt5}=\sqrt9=3$. Adding these together, we get $$\sqrt{\dfrac{1}{4}+\dfrac{13}{9}+3}=\sqrt{\dfrac{9+52+108}{36}}=\sqrt{\dfrac{169}{36}}=\boxed{\frac{13}{6}}.$$

question:
$$\sqrt{\dfrac{\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{80}}+\dfrac{\sqrt{845}}{9}+\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt5}}=\sqrt{\dfrac{\dfrac{5}{4\sqrt{5}}+\dfrac{\sqrt{845}}{9}+\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt5}}$$

$$=\sqrt{\dfrac{5\sqrt5+9\sqrt{845}+45\sqrt5}{36\sqrt5}}$$

$$=\sqrt{\dfrac{50\sqrt5+9\sqrt{845}+45\sqrt5}{36\sqrt5}}$$

$$=\sqrt{\dfrac{95\sqrt5+9\sqrt{845}}{36\sqrt5}}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{95\sqrt5+9\sqrt{845}}}{\sqrt{36\sqrt5}}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{95\sqrt5+9\sqrt{845}}}{6\sqrt5}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{95\sqrt5+9\sqrt{845}}}{6\sqrt5} \cdot \dfrac{\sqrt5}{\sqrt5}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{475+9\sqrt{845}}}{6\sqrt{25}}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{475+9\sqrt{845}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{45\cdot10+9\sqrt{845}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{9\cdot5\cdot10+9\sqrt{845}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{9\cdot50+9\sqrt{845}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{450+9\sqrt{845}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{450+9\cdot\sqrt{5}\cdot\sqrt{169}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{450+9\cdot13\cdot\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{450+117\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{333+117\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{11\cdot30+117\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{330+117\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{117\cdot3+117\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{117(3+\sqrt{5})}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{117}\cdot\sqrt{3+\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{117}\sqrt{3+\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{3\cdot3+\sqrt{5)\cdot3}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{9+3\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{6+3+3\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{9+3\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{3\cdot3+3\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{3(\sqrt{3}+\sqrt{5})}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{\sqrt{3}+\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{\sqrt{3}+\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{\sqrt{3}+\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

$$=\dfrac{\sqrt{3}\sqrt{\sqrt{3}+\sqrt{5}}}{30}$$

ground_truth:
First, we'll divide $\sqrt{5}$ into each term in the numerator of the fraction inside the big radical: $$\sqrt{\dfrac{\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{80}}+\dfrac{\sqrt{845}}{9}+\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt5}}=
\sqrt{\frac{5}{\sqrt{80}\cdot\sqrt{5}} + \frac{\sqrt{845}}{9\sqrt{5}} + \frac{\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt{5}}}.
$$Let's attack each fraction within the square root separately. First, $$\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{80}\cdot\sqrt5}=\dfrac{5}{\sqrt{400}}=\dfrac{5}{20}=\dfrac{1}{4}.$$The second one is trickier: $$\dfrac{\sqrt{845}}{9\sqrt5}=\dfrac{\sqrt{169}}{9}=\dfrac{13}{9}.$$Finally, $\dfrac{\sqrt{45}}{\sqrt5}=\sqrt9=3$. Adding these together, we get $$\sqrt{\dfrac{1}{4}+\dfrac{13}{9}+3}=\sqrt{\dfrac{9+52+108}{36}}=\sqrt{\dfrac{169}{36}}=\boxed{\frac{13}{6}}.$$
